intro: Paramollugo spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leafed mossy plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Commelinaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine, moss-like hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
